news.title: Sales of €1m-plus homes soar across Ireland as US buyers swoop in
news.summary: Sales of €1m-plus luxury homes across Ireland have surged dramatically amid ongoing supply shortages, continued demand, increasing prices and the ­impact of overseas buyers.

news.title: Former Dublin manager Jim Gavin believed to have Taoiseach’s backing for Fianna Fáil presidential run
news.summary: The former Dublin Gaelic football manager Jim Gavin is believed to have the support of Taoiseach Micheál Martin if he seeks to become the Fianna Fáil candidate for the presidential election.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Jim Gavin is a proven winner on big stage but Billy Kelleher is a disruptor in Fianna Fáil presidency saga
news.summary: Jim McGuinness is the only manager to have beaten Jim Gavin in the All-Ireland football championship.

news.title: Ranking the greats, part two: The top 30 football and hurling managers of last 50 years (numbers 25-21)
news.summary: How is a manager to be assessed? If he’s in charge of a traditionally higher-ranked county, is it simply a question of whether he led them to All-Ireland glory?

news.title: Revealed: Counties with highest number of patients receiving free Ozempic jab for diabetes
news.summary: More than 35,000 people were prescribed Ozempic for free to treat diabetes last year, with north Dublin and Galway the areas with the highest number of recipients.

news.title: ‘We think our old neighbour is grazing his cattle on our vacant family farm and we’re worried he could claim squatter’s rights. What can we do?’
news.summary: Query:  Dear Mary Frances, my brother and I are the joint owners of farm in the south of the country, and we have a problem with a neighbour who we think is trespassing.

news.title: And then there were six: who are the presidential contenders so far?
Enoch Burke back at school he was sacked from as new term begins
news.summary: Sacked teacher Enoch Burke has resumed showing up at Wilson’s Hospital School – even after the High Court ordered the draining of his bank account and daily contempt-of-court fines of €1,400.

news.title: Ksenia Samotiy: Why falling in love with Ireland has reinforced in me why Ukraine’s freedom is so vital
news.summary: When I first arrived in Ireland three-and-a-half years ago, I was not a tourist. I was not looking for sightseeing routes, hidden gems or travel guides. I was running from war in Ukraine. In those first days and weeks, survival was the only priority.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: ‘Robbie Williams feels like pop’s version of Jamie’s 30-Minute Meals, something you can rustle up at home with the most basic ingredients’
news.summary: A fancy word about Robbie Williams: preposterous. A simple word about Robbie Williams: Nope. And yet here we are, in late summer 2025, somehow in the middle of what the  Guardian  has called another “Robnaissance”.
